stopDtmfTone().Description: Instructs this RemoteConnection to stop any dual-tone multi-frequency signaling (DTMF) tone currently playing. DTMF tones are played by calling @B_android#telecom#RemoteConnection#playDtmfTone_E@. If no DTMF tone is currently playing, this method will do nothing.

unregisterCallback(android.telecom.Remot.Description: Removes a callback from this RemoteConnection.

Returns: true if the RemoteConnection's current audio mode is VOIP.
isVoipAudioMode().Description: Determines if the audio mode of this RemoteConnection is VOIP.

getExtras().Description: Obtain the extras associated with this RemoteConnection.

registerCallback(android.telecom.RemoteC.Description: Adds a callback to this RemoteConnection.

Returns: The address (e.g., phone number) to which the RemoteConnection is currently connected.
getAddress().Description: Obtains the address of this RemoteConnection.

pullExternalCall().Description: Instructs this @B_android#telecom#RemoteConnection_E@ to pull itself to the local device. See @B_android#telecom#Call#pullExternalCall_E@ for more information.

Returns: A bitmask of the capabilities of the RemoteConnection, as defined in the CAPABILITY_* constants in class @B_android#telecom#Connection_E@.
getConnectionCapabilities().Description: Obtains the capabilities of this RemoteConnection.

Parameters: char: A character representing the DTMF digit for which to play the tone. This value must be one of '0' through '9', '*' or '#'.
playDtmfTone(char).Description: Instructs this RemoteConnection to play a dual-tone multi-frequency signaling (DTMF) tone. Any other currently playing DTMF tone in the specified call is immediately stopped.

Returns: Whether the RemoteConnection is requesting that the framework play a ringback tone on its behalf.
isRingbackRequested().Description: Determines whether this RemoteConnection is requesting ringback.

getConference().Description: Obtain the RemoteConference that this RemoteConnection may be a part of, or null if there is no such RemoteConference.

unhold().Description: Instructs this @B_android#telecom#Connection#STATE_HOLDING_E@ call to release from hold.

Returns: For a @B_android#telecom#Connection#STATE_DISCONNECTED_E@ RemoteConnection, the disconnect cause expressed as a code chosen from among those declared in @B_android#telecom#DisconnectCause_E@.
getDisconnectCause().Description: Obtains the reason why this RemoteConnection may have been disconnected.

Returns: The video provider associated with this RemoteConnection.
getVideoProvider().Description: Obtains the video provider of this RemoteConnection.

Returns: The presentation requirements for the address. See @B_android#telecom#TelecomManager_E@ for valid values.
getAddressPresentation().Description: Obtains the presentation requirements for the address of this RemoteConnection.

Returns: A state value, chosen from the STATE_* constants.
getState().Description: Obtains the state of this RemoteConnection.

Returns: The video state of the RemoteConnection. See @B_android#telecom#VideoProfile_E@.
getVideoState().Description: Obtains the video state of this RemoteConnection.

Returns: The RemoteConnections with which this RemoteConnection may be merged into a @B_android#telecom#RemoteConference_E@.
getConferenceableConnections().Description: Obtain the RemoteConnections with which this RemoteConnection may be successfully asked to create a conference with.

Returns: The display name for the caller.
getCallerDisplayName().Description: Obtains the display name for this RemoteConnection's caller.

Returns: A bitmask of the properties of the RemoteConnection, as defined in the PROPERTY_* constants in class @B_android#telecom#Connection_E@.
getConnectionProperties().Description: Obtains the properties of this RemoteConnection.

Parameters: boolean: Whether or not to continue with the post-dial sequence.
postDialContinue(boolean).Description: Instructs this RemoteConnection to continue playing a post-dial DTMF string. A post-dial DTMF string is a string of digits following the first instance of either @B_android#telecom#TelecomManager#DTMF_CHARACTER_WAIT_E@ or @B_android#telecom#TelecomManager#DTMF_CHARACTER_PAUSE_E@. These digits are immediately sent as DTMF tones to the recipient as soon as the connection is made. If the DTMF string contains a @B_android#telecom#TelecomManager#DTMF_CHARACTER_PAUSE_E@ symbol, this RemoteConnection will temporarily pause playing the tones for a pre-defined period of time. If the DTMF string contains a @B_android#telecom#TelecomManager#DTMF_CHARACTER_WAIT_E@ symbol, this RemoteConnection will pause playing the tones and notify callbacks via @B_android#telecom#RemoteConnection#Callback#onPostDialWait_E@. At this point, the in-call app should display to the user an indication of this state and an affordance to continue the postdial sequence. When the user decides to continue the postdial sequence, the in-call app should invoke the @B_android#telecom#RemoteConnection#postDialContinue_E@ method.

Parameters: Handler: A Handler which command and status changes will be delivered to.
registerCallback(android.telecom.RemoteC.Description: Adds a callback to this RemoteConnection.
registerCallback(android.telecom.RemoteC.FullName: public void registerCallback (RemoteConnection.Callback callback, Handler handler)

Returns: The presentation requirements for the caller display name. See @B_android#telecom#TelecomManager_E@ for valid values.
getCallerDisplayNamePresentation().Description: Obtains the presentation requirements for this RemoteConnection's caller's display name.

Returns: The current @B_android#telecom#StatusHints_E@ of this RemoteConnection, or null if none have been set.
getStatusHints().Description: Obtains status hints pertaining to this RemoteConnection.

Parameters: CallAudioState: The audio state of this RemoteConnection.
setCallAudioState(android.telecom.CallAu.Description: Set the audio state of this RemoteConnection.

hold().Description: Instructs this RemoteConnection to go on hold.

ClassDesc: A connection provided to a @B_android#telecom#ConnectionService_E@ by another ConnectionService running in a different process.
